Robot#

The class Robot represents the API to interact with the AutomationWare cobot AWTube.

Example on how to use the API:

from awtube.robot import Robot

robot = Robot('102.168.0.0', port='9001')

# to start communication with robot
robot.start()

# to enable the robot, activate the actuators
robot.enable()

# send a move_line command
robot.move_line(
          {"x": 400,
           "y": -50,
           "z": 650},
          {"x": 0.8660254037844387,
           "y": 3.0616169978683824e-17,
           "z": 0.49999999999999994,
           "w": 5.3028761936245346e-17})

# set the target of the system to either be the physical machine or the simulation
from awtube.types import MachineTarget
robot.set_machine_target(MachineTarget.SIMULATION)

# to disable the robot, deactivate actuators
robot.disable()

# kill connection
robot.kill()

Reference of the class awtube.robot#

Robot offers all possible ways to interact with the machine.

class awtube.robot.Robot(robot_ip: str = '0.0.0.0', port: str = '9001', config_path: str = None, name: str = 'AWTube', log_level: int | str = 20, logger: Logger | None = None)#

Bases: object

Robot class used to interact with the robot arm.

disable()#

Sync wrapper for disable_async()

async disable_async()#

Disable robot.

enable()#

Sync wrapper for enable_async()

async enable_async()#

Enable machine by setting it’s state to OPERATION_ENABLED coroutine.

kill()#

Stop communication with robot.

move_joints(joints: list)#

Sync wrapper for move_joints_async()

async move_joints_async(joints: list)#

Send a moveJoints command.

move_joints_interpolated(points)#

Send a trajectory.

async move_joints_interpolated_async(points)#

Send a moveLine command to be executed by the controller.

move_line(translation: Dict[str, float], rotation: Dict[str, float])#

Sync wrapper for move_line_async()

async move_line_async(translation: Dict[str, float], rotation: Dict[str, float])#

Send a moveLine command. translation dict with keys {‘x’, ‘y’, ‘z’} rotation dict with keys {‘x’, ‘y’, ‘z’, ‘w’}

move_to_position(translation: Dict[str, float], rotation: Dict[str, float], tag: int = 0)#

Send a moveToPosition command.

Args:

translation (tp.Dict[str, float]): dict of translation x, y, z rotation (tp.Dict[str, float]): Dict of rotation, a quaternion: x, y, z, w tag (int, optional): tag(id) with which to send the command to the robot. Defaults to 0.

async move_to_position_async(translation: Dict[str, float], rotation: Dict[str, float])#
pause_stream()#

Pause stream. Sets velocity to zero, to restart increase velocity and call run()

run_stream()#

Run stream. Used after stopping or pausing.

set_dout(position: int, value: int, override: bool = True)#

Sync wrapper for set_dout_async()

async set_dout_async(position: int, value: int, override: bool)#

Send set digital out command.

set_machine_target(target: MachineTarget)#
async set_machine_target_async(target: MachineTarget)#
set_safe_limits(value: bool = True)#

Disable internal safe limits of motion controller.

async set_safe_limits_async(value: bool)#
set_speed(value: float)#

Set speed (0.0-2.0).

async set_speed_async(value: float)#
start()#

Start communication with robot.

stop_stream()#

Stop stream. Sets velocity to zero, to restart increase velocity and call run()
